elements.title: Enchylium limosum (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Enchylium limosum (example pictured) loves lime?

elements.title: Frederick Kimble (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that despite graduating last in his West Point class, Frederick Kimble eventually became a general?

elements.title: 18×2 Beyond Youthful Days (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 2024 film 18×2 Beyond Youthful Days was filmed in Japan in March to capture both snowfalls and cherry blossoms in the same month?

elements.title: Chestnut Street Opera House (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a will bequeathing the Chestnut Street Opera House to the University of Pennsylvania was contested at the Supreme Court of Pennsylvania?

elements.title: Jonny Pelham (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the comedian Jonny Pelham is one of only 200 people in the UK to suffer from popliteal pterygium syndrome?

elements.title: You're Losing Me (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that after a CD edition of Taylor Swift's album Midnights containing the exclusive song "You're Losing Me" was released at MetLife Stadium, some of the first purchasers uploaded the song online?

elements.title: Nighat Arif (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that BBC Breakfast's resident doctor Nighat Arif has advocated for more women to be given vibrators for medical reasons?

elements.title: Soviet prisoners of war were (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Soviet prisoners of war were the second-largest group of victims of Nazi mass killing?

elements.title: Katherine Sleeper Walden (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Katherine Sleeper Walden was a journalist, postmistress, innkeeper, community organizer, environmental activist, and conservationist who now has three mountains named after her?
